items.title: 'Magnificent' Buttler innings puts England on course for huge total
items.summary: Jos Buttler hits 83 runs off 30 balls, including seven sixes, to give England an incredible start, moving them to 126-1 inside eight overs in the second T20 against South Africa at Old Trafford.

items.title: Ripped Crawford weighs same as champion Canelo
items.summary: A shredded Terence Crawford - jumping up two divisions - weighed the same as champion Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez for Saturday's Las Vegas super-fight.

items.title: Salt gets England off to smashing start against South Africa
items.summary: Phil Salt hits three fours and a six off Marco Jansen to get England off to a flying start with a score of 18-0 after the first over in the second T20 at Old Trafford.

items.summary: European Championship winners England announce a series of four home fixtures to take place in 2025.

items.title: USA sprinter Knighton handed four-year doping ban
items.summary: United States sprinter Erriyon Knighton is handed a four-year ban after the Court of Arbitration for Sport partially upholds appeals from World Athletics and Wada.

items.title: Slot discusses Isak's fitness & missing out on Guehi
items.summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot speaks about new signing Alexander Isak's fitness after his deadline day move from Newcastle, and about missing out on signing Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi.

items.title: Wrexham deserve praise for buliding 'outstanding' squad
items.summary: Conor Coady feels Wrexham deserve praise for assembling an "outstanding" squad in the aftermath of securing a third successive promotion.

items.title: Love stars as Packers keep up winning start to season
items.summary: Jordan Love throws for two touchdowns and 292 yards, while Josh Jacobs scores a rushing touchdown in his 11th straight game as the Green Bay Packers maintain their impressive start to the NFL season.

items.title: Isak going on 'strike' changed relationship - Howe
items.summary: Eddie Howe says his relationship with Alexander Isak changed after the former Newcastle United centre-forward went on "strike".

items.title: Wafer fit for France quarter-final but McMahon out
items.summary: Ireland back row Aoife Wafer will make her first appearance at the Women's Rugby World Cup in the quarter-final against France in Exeter on Sunday.

items.title: Nvidia and Kioxia target 100 million IOPS SSD in 2027 â€”  AI server drives aim to deliver 33 times more performance
items.summary: Kioxia is working with Nvidia to develop a 100 million IOPS SSD for AI servers by 2027, likely leveraging unconventional NAND architectures.

items.title: Intel's 14nm+++ desktop CPUs are making a comeback â€” chipmaker inexplicably resurrects Comet Lake from five years ago with 'new' Core i5-110
items.summary: Intel has launched the Core i5-110, a six-core, 12-thread Comet Lake processor with a $200 MSRP.

items.title: Lexar NM1090 Pro 4TB SSD Review: A 'Budget' High-End Drive
items.summary: The Lexar NM1090 Pro is not a bad drive, but its appeal is somewhat limited given its position in the market. It has good all-around performance, but it isn't exceptional.

items.title: Auld enemies to old news, but Scotland aim to reignite rivalry
items.summary: England have not lost to Scotland this millennium. But Donna Kennedy, among the last Scots to beat England, says the current crop will believe they can oust the World Cup hosts.

items.title: DOOM multiplayer tribute gets coded in 'pure SQL' and runs at 30FPS â€” made from just 150 lines of code in less than a month
items.summary: A computer scientist used only 'pure SQL' to construct a multiplayer DOOM-like game that runs at 30 FPS.

items.title: 'I want to win trophies' - Postecoglou excited by Forest ambition
items.summary: New Nottingham Forest manager Ange Postecoglou says he's "excited to be back in the Premier League" and that he wants to win trophies with the club after being officially unveiled at the City Ground.

items.title: Top China silicon figure calls on country to stop using Nvidia GPUs for AI â€” says current AI development model could become 'lethal' if not addressed
items.summary: VP of China SIA Wei Shaojun urged China and other Asian nations to abandon reliance on Nvidia GPUs for AI and instead develop dedicated processors for LLM training to ensure long-term technological independence.

items.title: Windows 11 25H2 ISOs released after delays â€” upgrade switches on some features, now available for insiders
items.summary: Microsoft has released ISO install media for Windows 11 version 25H2, the next feature update in its annual release cycle. As of September 10, official ISOs are available via the Windows Insider download page.

items.title: Taiwan increases defensive patrols around 24 undersea cables â€” closely monitoring '96 blacklisted China-linked boats' with 24-hour operations
items.summary: Taiwan has intensified patrols around the 24 undersea cables that connect it with the global internet.

items.title: Researchers develop modified glue gun that can print bone â€” device 3D prints synthetic grafts directly onto patientsâ€™ living tissue during surgery
items.summary: A research team modified a hot glue gun for use in orthopedic surgery, allowing for faster bone healing.

items.title: OpenAI signs contract to buy $300 billion worth of Oracle computing power over the next five years â€” company needs 4.5 gigawatts of power, enough to power four million homes
items.summary: OpenAI and Oracle have signed one of the largest technology deals in history, worth $300 billion. Over five years starting in 2027, Oracle will provide OpenAI with over 4.5 gigawatts worth of computing power to help power ChatGPT and other AI products and services.

items.title: ASRock X870 Nova WiFi Motherboard Review: Lots of storage, not without sacrifice
items.summary: ASRockâ€™s X870 Nova offers users a good balance between the more expensive X870E and lower-end B850 Chipsets. But take a close look at how bandwidth is shared if you plan to use a lot of M.2-based storage.

items.title: Nano11 compresses Windows 11 install footprint to as little as 2.8GB â€” 'extreme experimental script' is 3.5 times smaller than Tiny11 and comes with 'none of the fluff'
items.summary: Nano11 Builder for Windows 11 produces the smallest Windows 11 installer ISOs and finished installation sizes yet.

items.title: Apple's A19 Pro beats Ryzen 9 9950X in single-thread Geekbench tests â€” iPhone 17 Pro chip packs 11-12% CPU performance bump, GPU performance up 37% over predecessor
items.summary: Apple's latest A19 Pro offers an 11% - 12% higher CPU performance compared to its predecessor and even beats desktop-class CPUs. However, the main advantage of the A19 Pro is its GPU.

items.title: Hyte warns Thicc Q80 Trio customers should uninstall AIO cooler immediately â€” company says it has identified coolant leakage issue caused by 'fragile internal component'
items.summary: Hyte has identified an issue with some of the company's new Thicc Q80 Trio that are leaking coolant during transport.

items.title: How Hodgkinson found strength in 'most challenging year'
items.summary: Britain's Keely Hodgkinson aims to add the world 800m title to her Olympic gold in Tokyo.

items.title: China's chip champions ramp up production of AI accelerators at domestic fabs, but HBM and fab production capacity are towering bottlenecks
items.summary: Millions of China-made AI accelerators are incoming from multiple companies in 2025 - 2026, but they may not be enough to meet the performance demands of local AI companies.

items.title: U.S. places $11 million bounty on Ukrainian ransomware mastermind â€” Tymoshchuk allegedly stole $18 billion from large companies over 3 years
items.summary: Volodymyr Tymoshchuk has been indicted by the United States for his involvement in ransomware crimes that stole an estimated $18 billion from large companies from 2018 to 2021. While the U.S. waits on extradition efforts, an $11 million bounty has been placed on his head.

items.title: At 4,500 hours, MSI's OLED MPG 321URX is showing noticeable visual artifacts â€” intentional burn-in test shows the limits of monitor tech after 18 months of non-top use
items.summary: Monitors Unboxed published a new burn-in update of its MSI MPG 321URX after over 4,000 hours of use. The monitor is finally developing visible burn-in that is subtly affecting day-to-day use.

items.title: $142 upgrade kit and spare modules turn Nvidia RTX 4090 24GB to 48GB AI card â€” technician explains how Chinese factories turn gaming flagships into highly desirable AI GPUs
items.summary: Russian technician VIK-on shows how to upgrade the GeForce RTX 4090's 24GB memory to 48GB in a new YouTube video.

items.title: Samsung 9100 Pro 8TB SSD review: Bigger, badder, and better
items.summary: Samsung pushes the limit with the 8TB 9100 Pro, offering the first large-capacity high-end PCIe 5.0 drive. Itâ€™s a good drive, but the price might cause some hesitation.

items.title: Lucky bidder scoops $8,000 PC for $23 at auction â€” Mislabelled Fractal Design case listing had 24-core Threadripper 3960X, 256GB of memory, and an RTX 3080 Ti inside
items.summary: A lucky online auction bidder has scored an $8,000 PC for just $23, bidding on a mislabelled Fractal Design case that actually had a full system inside.

items.title: Halot X-1 review: A solid step forward for serious hobbyists
items.summary: Halot's X-1 offers great prints, smart features, and a few growing pains.

items.title: Nvidiaâ€™s latest RTX Remix update brings path-traced particles to classic games â€” major overhaul promises 'tens of thousands' of particles without significant performance reduction
items.summary: Nvidiaâ€™s modding platform for retrofitting classic games with ray tracing has just had a huge overhaul, with updates including an "advanced path-traced particle system."

items.title: Slot an 8TB WD Black SN850X into your PC now that it's at one of its lowest-ever prices of $539 â€” Install all your favorite games on one drive
items.summary: Pop a massive 8TB drive into your PC and not worry about storage space on your M.2 SSD. The SN850X 8TB is now only $539.

items.title: Nvidia claims software and hardware upgrades allow Blackwell Ultra GB300 to dominate MLPerf benchmarks â€” touts 45% DeepSeek R-1 inference throughput increase over GB200
items.summary: Nvidia is claiming the top spot in GPU performance in a range of AI benchmarks for open-source models, claiming its new Blackwell Ultra GB300 platform is the best choice for data centers seeking to maximize profitability for AI inference in the future.

items.title: How to make graphical Python apps the EasyGUI way
items.summary: Amidst a forest of GUI framework choices, EasyGUI takes its name to heart and provides an exceptionally straightforward means to create your own graphical Python applications.

items.title: Intel confirms Arrow Lake refresh set for 2026, Nova Lake later that year â€” company admits there are 'holes to fill on the desktop front,' says it is 'confident in the roadmap'
items.summary: Intel has confirmed it will launch a refresh of its Arrow Lake, Core Ultra 200 CPUs in 2026, followed by the debut of its next-generation Nova Lake designs towards the end of the year, going into 2027.

items.title: Nvidia Rubin CPX forms one half of new, "disaggregated" AI inference architecture â€” approach splits work between compute- and bandwidth-optimized chips for best performance
items.summary: Nvidia's Rubin CPX GPU will be Nvidia's complement to the upcoming Vera Rubin AI rack, a wholly inference-focused GPU to work in tandem with high-end Rubin products. The cut-down GPU is paired with onboard GDDR7 memory rather than HBM and will be available as an optional upgrade from the base Vera â€¦

items.title: Microsoft key resale fight heads to court in the UK â€” case potentially puts cheap Windows keys at risk
items.summary: The legality of second-hand Microsoft Windows and Office licenses is back under the microscope as the companyâ€™s battle with a UK-based reseller returns to court this week.

items.title: 3D Pinball bug allowed the game to run at 5,000 FPS in Windows NT when faster CPUs arrivedâ€” former Microsoft programmer didn't add a rev limiter when porting game from Windows 95 to NT
items.summary: Dave Plummer, the Microsoft programmer who ported Pinball from Windows 95 to NT, didn't add a frame limiter to the game, which made it go into overdrive on more modern systems.

items.title: Apple debuts A19 and A19 Pro processors for iPhone 17, iPhone Air, and iPhone 17 Pro
items.summary: Apple introduced its A19 and A19 Pro processors to power its new line of iPhones, including the iPhone 17, iPhone Air, iPhone 17 Pro, and iPhone 17 Pro Max.

items.title: Atari Gamestation Go handheld goes up for pre-order â€” retro deck boasts 200+ classic games and unique physical controls
items.summary: Atari has put up its Gamestation Go retro handheld up for pre-order, priced at $179 and with shipping scheduled to begin next month.

items.title: Lucky gamer scores Nvidia's RTX 3060 12GB for $4.99 â€” one of the most popular graphics cards ever found for less than a Big Mac at a thrift shop
items.summary: A fortunate Redditor has found and bought a used GeForce RTX 3060 graphics card for $4.99.

items.title: JavaScript packages with billions of downloads were injected with malicious code in world's largest supply chain hack, geared to steal crypto â€” a phishing email is all it took to undermine npm packages
items.summary: JavaScript packages with billions of downloads were compromised by an unknown threat actor looking to steal cryptocurrency.

items.title: Star Wars Outlaws developer explains that Nintendo Switch 2 game cards are too slow for a physical game release â€” Snowdrop game engine uses disk data streaming to render the game world
items.summary: Ubisoft wasnâ€™t being â€˜cheapâ€™ by opting to deliver Star Wars Outlaws for Nintendo Switch 2 via Game-Key Card, according to a developer who worked on the title.

items.title: Red Sea undersea cable cuts that slowed internet over the weekend blamed on commercial shipping â€” sabotage seems unlikely, but repairs could take weeks
items.summary: A few days after signs of cable disruptions surfaced in the Red Sea, experts are pointing to a more prosaic explanation than initial fears of targeted sabotage.

items.title: Must-watch events at World Athletics Championships
items.summary: BBC Sport looks at six of the must-watch events as the World Athletics Championships get under way in Tokyo, Japan.

items.summary: The story of the legendary comic band returning to the big screen after 40 years.

items.title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
items.summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

items.title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
items.summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

items.summary: Hannah Hampton on overcoming a serious eye condition to rise to become England's number one goalkeeper at Euro 2025.

items.summary: Wimbledon is without line judges for the first time - will 'sport's best dressed officials' be missed?
